title: Polly & Grant missing from the airwaves after her attack on radio bosses
text:
Polly & Grant missing from the airwaves after her attack on radio bosses Last updated 10:12, February 7 2017 POLLY GILLESPIE/FACEBOOK 
Polly Gillespie is off air and her employers are refusing to say when she will be back. 
Gillespie and co-host Grant Kereama didn't front their morning show on The Hits radio station on Tuesday after she gave an extensive interview to Stuff - and posted a long Facebook video - attacking her bosses for what she said was plans to cancel her show. 
The Hits' owners, NZME, wouldn't say when or if the pair would return to their morning radio show. FACEBOOK 
Polly Gillespie posted a frank video on her Facebook page, in which she dyed her hair and spoke about her new contract. 
The Hits' content director Todd Campbell and NZME group entertainment director Dean Buchanan repeatedly declined to comment when asked when Gillespie would be back. 
â€‹In an emotional Facebook video , Gillespie said she had been offered a "very generous and lucrative" new contract, but it came with some significant drawbacks. The new contract would restrict her social media use and could potentially break up the radio duo, she said.
